title: FreesearchR viden
text:
Preface
This is a Quarto book.
To learn more about Quarto books visit https://quarto.org/docs/books.

title: 1  FreesearchR app intro
text:
1.1 The FreesearchR app
The FreesearchR app is published as an R-package for easy installation in a local R-environment and is also accessible directly online in your web browser.
Currently, the app introduction lives in the package documentation and is accessible here.

title: 2  Mental health after stroke
text:
2.1 Mental health after stroke
For the following case study on using the FreesearchR tool, the following article will be used as an example: Damsbo m.fl. (2020).
This article includes a table of baseline characteristics, a regression table and an Euler plot of overlapping markers of poor well-being after stroke. Based on a anonymised dataset, the basics of each of these elements will be recreated in the following.

title: 2  Mental health after stroke
text: Damsbo, Andreas Gammelgaard, Kristian Lundsgaard Kraglund, Henriette Nørmølle Buttenschøn, Søren Paaske Johnsen, Grethe Andersen, og Janne Kaergaard Mortensen. 2020. “Predictors for Wellbeing and Characteristics of Mental Health After Stroke”. Journal of Affective Disorders 264 (marts): 358–64. https://doi.org/10.1016/j.jad.2019.12.032.

title: 3  Randomised clinical trial in stroke
text:
3.1 A clinical trial on neuroprotection in stroke
This case study will be based on the study “Neuroregeneration and Vascular Protection by Citalopram in Acute Ischemic Stroke (TALOS)”.(Kraglund m.fl. 2018)
We will not be able to include all data from this trial, but key tables and figures based on anonymised data from the trial included in the FreesearchR app will be used.
crumbs: 3  Randomised clinical trial in stroke

title: 3  Randomised clinical trial in stroke
text: Kraglund, Kristian Lundsgaard, Janne Kaergaard Mortensen, Andreas Gammelgaard Damsbo, Boris Modrau, Sofie Amalie Simonsen, Helle Klingenberg Iversen, Morten Madsen, Erik Lerkevang Grove, Søren Paaske Johnsen, og Grethe Andersen. 2018. “Neuroregeneration and Vascular Protection by Citalopram in Acute Ischemic Stroke (TALOS)”. Stroke 49 (11): 2568–76. https://doi.org/10.1161/strokeaha.117.020067.
crumbs: 3  Randomised clinical trial in stroke

title: 4  Further learning
text:
4.1 Where to go next
The FreesearchR project is not affiliated with the listed references below unless stated.
Exercism is a great place to start for open languages (R, Python, Julia or something more exotic), where everything can run in the browser and you don’t need to download anything. You can track your progress and get hints.
